fields.description:
h4.Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Go to *Create* a workflow draft.
# Edit the workflow transition conditions.
# Change from *"All of the following conditions"* to *"Any of the following conditions"*.
# Publish the workflows.
# View back the workflow transition condition again, it's show *"All of the following conditions"*.

h4.Finding
* Conditions working fine but the view is different.
fields.summary: Workflow conditions switch back from "Any of the following conditions" to "All of the following conditions" after edit

fields.description:
Steps to repro:

1. Issues -> "My Open Issues"
2. Click on one of n > 1 issues from the left-side menu
3. Issue is loaded on the right side of the page, click "Close Issue"
4. "No issues found.." message appears
5. If I click the spy-glass icon to search again, the remaining issues re-appear in the left-side menu

I get that the open issue no longer matches the filters, but this means I can't close multiple open issues without navigating to "My Open Issues" after every single issue is closed.
fields.summary: Marking an issue resolved results in "no issues found" message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35917].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The JIRA Workflow Step Property {{jira.permission.browse}} does not prevent you to view issues in issue navigator.

h3. Steps to replicate:
# Create an issue
# Create a group named 'test'
# Edit the workflow for the project of the issue created in step 1.
# Click 'View Properties' next to the step the issue created in step 1 is currently in.
# Add the following property
{noformat}
key: jira.permission.browse.group.1
value: test
{noformat}
# Search for the issue created in step 1 (ensuring you are not in the group 'test')

h3. Result:
The issue navigator will show the issue, but when you try and click into it you will receive the message:
{quote}
<Issue Key> can not be opened. The issue may have been deleted or you might not have permission to see the issue.
{quote}

h3. Expected Result:
You shouldn't be able to see the issue in the issue navigator.

h3. Notes:
This was also tested and reproduced with the {{jira.permission.browse.reporter}} property.
fields.summary: JIRA Workflow Step Property jira.permission.browse allows you to view issues in issue navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35916].
  {panel}

Use Case: Some stakeholders are only casual users of JIRA and don't do more than log in, look at one or two dashboards, maybe a filter, and log out.

As it currently stands as an admin I can share the filters and dashboards with them, but cannot have them marked as favorites when they first log in. This means that I either have to have them 'star' the dashboards themselves, or on account creation log in as them and start it myself.

It would be great if as an admin on sharing a dashboard or filter to a users/group I could also force it into their favorites so that when new (or non-savvy users) log in information relevant to them is directly available.

System dashboard isn't as useful as I can't customize per user.
fields.summary: Manage Faviroute Dashbaord and Filters of Users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35912].
  {panel}

JIRA users get errors when trying to set authentication with an external method. 

*Current scenario*:

The JIRA Fisheye Plugin uses either the P4PASSWD variable or the -P command line option to pass the password to p4.exe. 

*Issue*:

When an external authentication trigger is used in Perforce (such as CROWD), passwords can not be passed on the command line as plain text or stored in P4PASSWD, so the JIRA Fisheye Plugin cannot log in.

*Workaround*

The only way around this is by generating a ticket (using the -p option as explained here: [p4 login|http://ftp.perforce.com/perforce/r07.2/doc/manuals/cmdref/login.html]) and using it in place of the password in the JIRA Fisheye Plugin. More information on this [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Perforce+password+%28P4PASSWD%29+invalid+or+unset+on+JIRA+Fisheye+plugin].

*Suggested resolution*

JIRA should provide more ways (on the screen) to allow this authentication.
fields.summary: JIRA should allow additional authentication methods to Perforce job integration

fields.description:
Assign Issue notification Not sent to a user  when the Assign Issue operation contains a comment that is restricted to a group that the user doesn't belong to.

h3.Steps to reproduce:
# Navigate to the Notification Scheme, and make sure that the scheme contains the Assigned Issue notification to sent to a user (let's say user A)
# Go to an issue, and try to assign the issue to the user without restricting the comment, the notification will be sent as expected.
# Now try to asisgn another issue to the same user, but this time put a comment and restrict it to a group that the user A doesn't belong to, you will notice that the notification is not sent to the user.
fields.summary: Assign Issue notification Not sent to a user

fields.description:
I have created a large number of users in our new Jira installation (licensed for 10 users), but kept most of them inactive until they are actually needed.

This works fine as inactive users don't count against the license.
I made a mistake early on in removing the jira-users group from each of them!

So now, when using the Bulk Editing of Groups feature to try to assign all of them back to the jira-users group, I get the error that this would breach my license... even though all but three are inactive!

PS.: This is not a Support issue, as I have now re-assigned them all one-by-one, which worked ok. The issue is definitely a bug, as the bulk group editor should take into account whether users are inactive or not when checking for license applicability.
fields.summary: Bulk Group Assignment breaches License Despite Inactive Users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35902].
  {panel}

Hi

Stash, Fisheye and Crucible all support setting a custom Gravatar URL.

Stash lets you customize the URL completely, which means you can have a non-Gravatar compatible avatar/thumbnail server, or just a directory of JPEGs (e.g. http://intranet/pictures/%4$s.jpg) 

Fisheye/Crucible allow for a Gravatar compatible URL to be customized. So if you have implemented a local/intranet Gravatar compatible endpoint as we have, you can point Fisheye/Crucible at that to get avatars.

However the Gravatar support in JIRA is hard coded. All I would like is the ability to customize the Gravatar URL which is used so I can point it at our local Gravatar service and have one source for avatar pictures across our Atlassian setup.

I don't mind if this is something which needs to be configured via application properties (this is how Stash works)
fields.summary: Gravatar in JIRA should support custom Gravatar URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35892].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Currently JIRA has the ability of migrate users and groups between the [Internal|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+the+Internal+Directory] and [Internal with LDAP authentication|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+an+Internal+Directory+with+LDAP+Authentication] directory. This feature is being tracked in the following tickets:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24213
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-27868

However, this feature does not include the ability of migrate groups and group membership to the directory of type [connector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+an+Internal+Directory+with+LDAP+Authentication].

h3. Suggested feature
In some cases administrators want to move from [Internal|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+the+Internal+Directory] or [Internal with LDAP authentication|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+an+Internal+Directory+with+LDAP+Authentication] to the directory of type [connector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+an+Internal+Directory+with+LDAP+Authentication].

The directory of type connector synchronizes all the users and groups from the LDAP automatically, but it won't associate those users to the local groups. It would be good if JIRA had the ability of migrate the local group membership to the connector directory.
fields.summary: As an administrator, it would be good if JIRA had the ability to migrate group membership among directories

fields.description:
The components list doesn't show all the available options to the users anymore.  Instead there is this thing on the bottom saying "x more options, continue typing..." and that line can't even be clicked on to show more options.  This is a very big problem for our users as they do not memorize all the options.  Also, this is a pre-defined list of available options that need to be selected correctly.  How is the user supposed to automatically know what all the options are?

This change was not listed in any release notes that i have found, and therefore i am creating this as a bug since it is not working as it once was prior to our upgrade.

To clarify, in the previous version we were running (5.2.6), it would say the "x more options.  Continue typing to refine further" message after you have started typing in the box.  However, now that shows up even if you just click the drop down and not type anything.  This doesn't make sense since i have not typed anything, so how can i continue typing.  In 5.2.6 it would still show the entire list if you didn't type anything yet.  That behavior is great and works perfect, please fix this bug so that you see the whole list if you have not started typing anything in the components box (Autocomplete renderer field).
fields.summary: Components list doesn't show all options

	at com.atlassian.jira.config.AbstractIssueConstantsManager.createConstant(AbstractIssueConstantsManager.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultStatusManager.createStatus(DefaultStatusManager.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.config.DefaultStatusService.createStatus(DefaultStatusService.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.statuses.ViewStatuses.addConstant(ViewStatuses.java:196)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.constants.AbstractViewConstants.doAddConstant(AbstractViewConstants.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.statuses.ViewStatuses.doAddStatus(ViewStatuses.java:134)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:70)
[...]
{code}

Try to create it a second time and it'll work fine, as the new status is then created with an ID of 10001. The more custom issue statuses already exist in an instance, the more times you have to click Add in order to get past the latest ID.

h3. Workaround
If on OnDemand contact support, support will:

# Shutdown JIRA
# Backup the database
# Identify the current maximum value of the issuestatus id
{noformat}
select id::integer from issuestatus order by id desc limit 1;
{noformat}
# Update the sequence_value_item table to define the Status sequence ID as 1 higher than the value identified in the previous step
{noformat}
update sequence_value_item set seq_id = <value from above + 1> where seq_name = 'Status';
{noformat}
# Start JIRA back up.
fields.summary: JIRA unable to create statuses after upgrade to 6.2-OD-3/icebat-85.0 if there's previously been custom statuses created

fields.description:
My avatar on JIRA displays really fuzzy on my retina display laptop, making me look better than I actually am.  The result of this was that my ego got continually inflated each time I saw myself on JIRA, until that day when I auditioned for "Australia's Next Top Model", and my hopes were catastrophically dashed when they told me not only that was I not model material, but also that I was not a woman.

JIRA should display avatars in double resolution on high density displays.

This issue is closely related to JRA-29743, but that issue has become all about updating JIRA's icons, not about what resolution to display avatars at.
fields.summary: JIRA makes me look better than I actually am

When you are sent an email notification for a changed issue, if that issue includes a change to a free text field, the content in that field doesn't wrap. 
Consequently, the user can end up doing significant horizontal scrolling to read the changes.

This email happens to being shown on a very large, 24" screen. 

The user should not have to scroll horizontally as the content should wrap.

fields.description:
I have noticed that others have commented on my previous issues requesting that they be re-opened and also other users have opened new issues regarding this same thing.  The Description field should be persisted when using the "Create Another" checkbox.  Here is a synopsis of the reasons:
# It is easier to clear out the description field than to have to re-type a single word, sentence, paragraph, or section.
# If you made the change because the description field is "changed" for each issue, that is correct, it should be changed, however, if you follow that idea to it's conclusion, you should then clear ALL fields since they all need to be reviewed and possibly changed.
# This is in direct conflict with the original deployment of the feature and description of the feature as described on the JIRA 5.0 release notes: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+5.0+Release+Notes#JIRA5.0ReleaseNotes-customisabledialogbox.
{panel}
The *Create Issue* dialog box allows you to rapidly create a series of related issues with similar options. When you select the *Create another* check box before clicking the *Create* button, JIRA creates your issue and automatically pre-populates a new *Create Issue* dialog box with your previous field values, whilst leaving the *Summary* field blank. Be aware that any attachments attached to your previously created issue are not carried across by this feature.
{panel}

This should be re-addressed and re-released in a more usable fashion if there is going to be a change in the functionality.

My suggestion would be to default all fields to persist between issue creations, but allow administrators to add fields to a restricted list so that they are cleared between issue creations.
fields.summary: Description field no longer persists when using "Create another"

fields.description:
To reproduce:
1. Create 3 new roles "Admin A", "Admin B" and "No-Admin".
2. Assign these roles to different permissions but "admin project" only to "Admin A" and "Admin B"
3. Let a real Jira-Admin assign a non-admin user to role "Admin A".
4. Login as non-admin user and got to role page.
5. Add yourself to role "Admin B" and "No-Admin".
6. Now make this undone and try to remove yourself from role "Admin B" and "No-Admin"

Removing from "Admin B" will fail with
{quote}You can not remove a user/group that will result in completely removing yourself from this role.{quote}

This should be possible, but Jira does not remember from which role the user started his action.
fields.summary: Removing oneself from a role with admin permission fails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35842].
  {panel}

We have a base template of issues that we use for all of our projects within Target and then add additional issues as needed based on the project details itself.  It would be helpful to have a way to easily replicate this template.  
1) Either through importing from a source (after potential exporting from a set of data).
2) Perhaps a better option, creating a new "bulk change" feature with the option to "clone" a set of selected issues.  It is critical that the workflow be maintained that is being used by the rest of the projects within the Jira instance.  Also the issue type, etc.  Also it should ask if we want to show that this was cloned from something or not, so we don't have to go into each and remove the "cloned" references.  But could maintain them if desired.  These should look like a set of new issues when we are done.  We would like the option to set the "project", "version" and "Epic" they are assigned to.  Things like components, priority, should retain the values in the original, and assignee should be the default for the project we are cloning the issues to.  Ideally it would ask questions on these fields (retain or set to a new value).

The goal being to create an easier way to set-up a base set of issues for a project.
fields.summary: issue template replication

fields.description:
As discovered while troubleshooting reindex problems on an internal JIRA instance, a runtime exception raised by an issue's custom field prevents that issue from being indexed at all.  {{IssueDocument.getDocument(Issue)}} should be hardened such that only the problem custom field is dropped from the indexing, not the entire issue.  The data will still be wrong, but partial data is better than no data.

Ideally, the exception should be remembered and re-thrown after the issue has been indexed so that we can still report the problem.
fields.summary: IssueDocument should be hardened against ill-behaved CF plugins
AccumulatingResultBuilder needs to provide a way to get full stack traces during reindex

fields.description:
In working out the cause of [DESK-1692|https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/DESK-1692] on an internal JIRA instance, we discovered that the reason the background reindex did not have this problem was that its thread had the authentication context of the user that launched the background reindex.

This shouldn't matter, because nothing inside the indexing code should care who the current user is, but it is surprising and inconsistent with the foreground reindex.  The background reindex should probably be done with and anonymous user context as well.
fields.summary: Foreground and Background reindex have different authentication context states

fields.description:
Some of our URLs contain vertical bars (|). None of them can be stored in a field of type {{com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:url}} -- Jira, bogusly, claims, the URLs are invalid.

The simplest test case is
{noformat}http://example.com/true|that{noformat}

Notably, the automated link-renderer misparses such URLs too -- a Wiki bug, apparently:
http://example.com/true|that

It is possible, that other valid characters similarly invalidate perfectly acceptable URLs. But we are mostly affected by the vertical bars...
fields.summary: URLs with vertical bar unduly rejected by com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:url

fields.description:
After upgrading, a customer's users lost avatars they had created before the upgrade. Reproducing the error from his backup data, I found that the avatar table filter owner name was being evaluated in a case-sensitive manner, even though the owner of the avatar had been recorded as a lowercase only value. Changing the table to reflect usernames with the correct case reversed the problem and restored normal operation.

Avatars created after the upgrade reflect the correct case and are not affected by this issue.
fields.summary: Avatar ownership is now case sensitive

fields.description:
After upgrading, a customer's users lost access to filters they had created before the upgrade. Reproducing the error from his backup data, I found that the searchrequest table filter owner name was being evaluated in a case-sensitive manner, even though the owner of the request had been recorded as a lowercase only value. Changing the table to reflect usernames with the correct case reversed the problem and restored normal operation.

Filters created after the upgrade reflect the correct case and are not affected by this issue.
fields.summary: Filter ownership is case sensitive

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35824].
  {panel}

When I install an application from scratch I want to know that everything worked as expected. However when I install JIRA and there is no problem I still get various kinds of warnings. I even get an error that isn't really an error!

I'm not going to list out all the warnings and the error here because they've each been reported before over the past few years. Instead I'm going to submit this as an Improvement, or perhaps even as a Challenge for the JIRA team: 

"A JIRA install that works as expected must have no warnings or errors"

This would have the major benefit that when there are problems they are less likely to get ignored by JIRA administrators. It will be easier for Support to ignore what is irrelevant in the log files. I won't have to explain to customers repeatedly that they don't have to worry about those warnings and that error.
fields.summary: Why does a perfect JIRA install give me warnings and an error?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35821].
  {panel}

As an Jira user I want to see the default transaction action highlighted differently than the other ones.

Obviously the default transaction depends on each workflow and we define it a the most likely transaction from the current state. Probably this should be the the first one but not necessarly.

Now, if the workflow designer could add a property to mark the default transaction, this could be transposed to a CSS class, or even an extended HTML attribute, allowing the customization via CSS rules.

This is the request to allow us to define attributes that will reach the generated HTML code in order to be able to CSS mark the default button. 

The proposed solution it generic enough in order allow other use cases and without risking on impacting current implementation.
fields.summary: Allow CSS customizations of transaction buttons
